intro: Achyrophorus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower achyrophorus, is a unique plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its solitary, umbel-like inflorescence, which consists of a single flower at the center surrounded by reduced bracts. The plant is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Its botanical features include finely divided, fern-like leaves and a short, stout stem. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
